天 tiān titian 帝 Dì 𐀪 don deon theon god
天 ≈ 𐀪 in oracle bone script
𒀭 Dingir ≈ Tingir

天 Tengri, The forms of the name Tengri (Old Turkic: Täŋri)[7] among the ancient and modern Turks and Mongols are Tengeri, Tangara, Tangri, Tanri, Tangre, Tegri, Tingir, Tenkri, Teri, Ter, and Ture.[8] The name Tengri ("the Sky") is derived from Old Turkic: Tenk ("daybreak") or Tan ("dawn").[9] Meanwhile, Stefan Georg proposed that the Turkic Tengri ultimately originates as a loanword from Proto-Yeniseian *tɨŋgɨr- "high".
